document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the genus Xylota Meigen (Diptera: Syrphidae) in Korea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the genus Xylota Meigen (Diptera: Syrphidae) in Korea

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Xylota umbrosa
Violovitsh, 1975: 87
(type locality: Russia , Siberia, S. Primorje; holotype ♂ , ZISP);
Violovitsh, 1983: 139
(in Siberian key);
Mutin & Barkalov, 1999: 495
, 497 (in Russian Far East key).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Among Korean
Xylota
species,
X. umbrosa
is most similar to
X. hauseri
sp. n.
, especially having the purplish lustrous tinge on their black abdominal terga and the apex of the left arm of theca in male genitalia apicodorsally round. However,
X. hauseri
sp. n.
can be distinguished from
X. umbrosa
by the following characters: 1) male abdomen more or less parallel-sided but never medially constricted ( Figs 2F , 5A ); 2) right lateral arm of theca apico-dorsally with finely serrated ( Fig. 12G ). See also Diagnosis of
X. hauseri
sp. n.

Material examined.
SOUTH KOREA : Gangwon-do
:
1♂ , Hoengseong Dunnae-myeon , Mt. Cheongtaesan Sapgyo-ri to
1200m
peak,

.
Distribution. Korea (new record), Russian Far East.
Remarks. The Korean specimens agree with the original description ( Violovitsh, 1975 ) as well as the genitalic illustration by Mutin & Barkalov (1999) .
